tool.name: Get flanks
tool.description: returns flanking region/s for every gene

param.name: size
param.label: Enter the length of the desired flanking region/s

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**TIP:** If your data is not TAB delimited, use *Edit Queries->Convert characters*
-----
**Example**
- This tool finds the upstream and/or downstream flanking region/s of all the genes in the input file.
- For the following query::
chr7 100 600 gene1 0 + chr7 200 1000 gene2 0 -
- running **get flanks** with **flank length 50** and **location upstream** will return::
chr7 50 100 gene1 0 + chr7 1000 1050 gene2 0 -
